channel.title: Fix Compiler and Runserver problems, realy easy!
channel.description:
If you got problems with your compiler or runserver, here is a very simple solution: First check that you got the latest java installed, 1.6.0_03 I think. You can get the latest version here: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp If you got that installed, and it still dont work, try and use this simple, yet effective, compiler that compiles and then run the server:
[code] @echo off title INSERT TITLE HERE "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_03\bin\java.exe" server pause [/code]
Also check that the path is right :) That should solve your problem. I know that anyone that is somewhat skilled in Java can make a compiler that works 10.000 times better, so dont post anything like "Omg newb everyone can make a compiler like that!", this was made to help peoples that dont know how to make a working compiler.

item.title: Fix Compiler and Runserver problems, realy easy!
item.dc:creator: @Rob369 Rob369
item.description:
@Rob369 wrote:

I know no one can make 10.000 times better compiler, I was thinking of compilers like ex The Perfect Compiler v9 or something like that.

Read full topic

@Songoty wrote:

People only make the scripts to acess Sun’s Compiler, and noone can make one 10.000 times better, as they all use the same thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Fix Compiler and Runserver problems, realy easy!
item.dc:creator: @Rob369 Rob369
item.description:
@Rob369 wrote:

If you got problems with your compiler or runserver, here is a very simple solution:
First check that you got the latest java installed, 1.6.0_03 I think. You can get the latest version here: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
If you got that installed, and it still dont work, try and use this simple, yet effective, compiler that compiles and then run the server:

@echo off
title INSERT TITLE HERE
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java
"C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_03\bin\java.exe" server
pause

Also check that the path is right That should solve your problem.
I know that anyone that is somewhat skilled in Java can make a compiler that works 10.000 times better, so dont post anything like “Omg newb everyone can make a compiler like that!”, this was made to help peoples that dont know how to make a working compiler.
